Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The user wants me to generate a response based on the provided scenario I need to 1 Identify anomalies in the temporal profile model from the provided data 2 Generate hypotheses for why these anomalies exist 3 Propose SQL verification queries

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Key anomalies from the provided model R P Very low STDEV 3600 seconds 1 hour compared to the average 90000 seconds 25 hours This is suspiciously rigid P N Very high average 604800 seconds 7 days with high STDEV 172800 2 days Long delay with high variability A C Short time 7200 seconds 2 hours might indicate skipping steps E N Very short time 300 seconds 5 minutes might be automated or skipped steps

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: I should structure this clearly without referencing the instructions The response should look like an analysis of the temporal profile model provided Structure 1 Anomaly Identification section 2 Hypotheses section 3 SQL Verification Queries section

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For SQL queries I need to use PostgreSQL syntax and reference the schema provided claims adjusters claim_events Important SQL considerations Need to calculate time differences between activities for the same claim_id Need to join with claims table to get claim_type etc The adjuster assignment is activity A so the resource for A would be the adjuster

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Hypotheses RP rigidity Automated approval systems with fixed scheduling or batch processing at specific intervals PN delay Manual notification processes prone to backlogs or external communication delays mail vs email or resource constraints in customer service teams AC speed Straight through processing for low value claims or erroneous closures or fraud quick closure to avoid scrutiny EN speed Automated system notifications without human review or data quality issues timestamps recorded incorrectly

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For time differences I need self joins or window functions LAG LEAD functions would be efficient Or better pivot the activities WITH activity_times AS SELECT claim_id MAX CASE WHEN activity R THEN timestamp END as receive_time MAX CASE WHEN activity P THEN timestamp END as approve_time etc GROUP BY claim_id Then SELECT claim_id EXTRACT EPOCH FROM approve_time minus receive_time as r to p seconds

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For correlation with adjusters The adjuster is assigned during activity A so the resource column for activity A contains the adjuster_id or name WITH adjuster_assignment AS SELECT claim_id resource as adjuster_id FROM claim_events WHERE activity A then join with adjusters table on adjuster_id

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Double check the anomaly list RP Low STDEV 3600 vs Mean 90000 yes suspiciously rigid PN High mean 604800 and high STDEV 172800 yes 7 days avg 2 days stddev AC Short time 7200 yes 2 hours EN Short time 300 yes 5 minutes EC High STDEV 3000 vs Mean 3600 yes coefficient of variation is high almost 1
